canonical_explanation.text: A family is a group of people who live together and love each other. Our family has members like mother, father, brother, sister, and grandparents. Some families are small with just parents and children. Some families are big with grandparents, uncles, and aunts all living together. Family members help and care for each other.
rules: A family is made up of people who live together and care for each other.
Family members include mother, father, brother, sister, and grandparents.
A small family has parents and children. A big (joint) family has grandparents, uncles, and aunts too.
Each family member has a role: parents take care of children, grandparents share stories and wisdom.
Family members love, share, and help each other every day.

questions.question_text: Who is your mother's mother?
questions.explanation_correct: Your mother's mother is your grandmother. She is also called Nani in Hindi.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Your mother's mother is not your sister, aunt, or cousin. She is your grandmother (Nani).

questions.question_text: Who is your father's father?
questions.explanation_correct: Your father's father is your grandfather. He is also called Dada or Dada ji in Hindi.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Your father's father is not your uncle, brother, or father. He is your grandfather (Dada ji).

questions.question_text: A small family has:
questions.explanation_correct: A small family (nuclear family) has parents and their children living together. It usually has mother, father, and their kids.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A small family is not made of only grandparents, only children, or only parents. A small family has both parents and their children living together.

questions.question_text: A big family (joint family) has:

options.text: Parents, children, grandparents, uncles, and aunts

questions.explanation_correct: A big family or joint family has many people living together: parents, children, grandparents, uncles, and aunts. Many Indian families live as joint families.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A big family is not just two people, only children, or friends. A joint family has parents, children, grandparents, uncles, and aunts all living together in one home.

questions.question_text: Your father's brother is your:
questions.explanation_correct: Your father's brother is your uncle. In Hindi, he is called Chacha or Tauji.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Your father's brother is not your grandfather, brother, or cousin. He is your uncle.

questions.question_text: Your mother's sister is your:
questions.explanation_correct: Your mother's sister is your aunt. In Hindi, she is called Mausi.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Your mother's sister is not your grandmother, cousin, or sister. She is your aunt (Mausi).

questions.question_text: Who takes care of children at home?
questions.explanation_correct: Family members take care of children at home. Parents, grandparents, and other family members look after and care for children.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Strangers, nobody, or animals do not take care of children at home. It is family members like parents and grandparents who love and care for children.

questions.question_text: What do family members do for each other?
questions.explanation_correct: Family members love and help each other. They share, care, and support each other in good and bad times.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Families do not fight all the time, ignore each other, or stay far away. Family members love, care for, and help each other.

questions.question_text: Who are the oldest members in a family?
questions.explanation_correct: Grandparents are usually the oldest members in a family. They are the parents of our mother or father.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Children and babies are the youngest members, and parents are younger than grandparents. Grandparents are the oldest members of the family.

questions.question_text: Who are the youngest members in a family?
questions.explanation_correct: Children are usually the youngest members in a family. They are younger than parents and grandparents.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Grandparents are the oldest, parents and uncles are older than children. Children are the youngest members of the family.

questions.question_text: Anu's mother is sick. What should Anu do?

options.text: Help and take care of her

questions.explanation_correct: When Anu's mother is sick, Anu should help and take care of her. Family members should care for each other when someone is not well.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Going out to play, watching TV all day, or shouting are not the right things to do when a family member is sick. We should help and take care of them.

questions.question_text: It is Diwali at Rohan's home. What does his family do together?
questions.explanation_correct: During Diwali, Rohan's family celebrates together. They light diyas, share sweets, and enjoy the festival with each other. Families celebrate festivals together.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Diwali is a happy festival. Families do not sleep early, stay apart, or do nothing during festivals. They celebrate together, share sweets, and light diyas.

questions.question_text: Neha lives with her parents, brother, grandparents, uncle, and aunt. What type of family is this?
questions.explanation_correct: Neha lives with many family members including grandparents, uncle, and aunt. This is a big family or joint family.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A small family has only parents and children. Since Neha lives with grandparents, uncle, and aunt too, this is a big family (joint family), not a small family.

questions.question_text: Aditya lives with his mother, father, and sister. What type of family is this?
questions.explanation_correct: Aditya lives with only his parents and sister. This is a small family (nuclear family) because it has only parents and their children.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A big or joint family has grandparents, uncles, and aunts too. Since Aditya lives with only his parents and sister, this is a small family.

questions.question_text: Who cooks food for the family at home?

options.text: Family members like mother, father, or grandparents

questions.explanation_correct: Family members like mother, father, or grandparents cook food for the family at home. Any family member can cook.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A pet dog, TV, or school teacher does not cook food for the family. Family members like mother, father, or grandparents cook food at home.

questions.question_text: Your parents are your:
questions.explanation_correct: Your parents are your mother and father. They are the ones who take care of you and love you.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Parents are not school friends, siblings, or teachers. Your parents are your mother and father who raise and care for you.

questions.question_text: Siya has a new baby brother. What should she do?

options.text: Love and be gentle with the baby

questions.explanation_correct: Siya should love and be gentle with her new baby brother. A big sister should care for and protect her younger brother.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Being angry, ignoring, or running away from a baby brother is not right. Siya should love and be gentle with her baby brother, as family members care for each other.

questions.question_text: Grandparents often tell children:
questions.explanation_correct: Grandparents often tell children stories and share their wisdom. They have many experiences and love to share them with their grandchildren.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Grandparents do not just give maths problems, stay quiet, or share only sad things. They love to tell stories and share their knowledge and wisdom with children.

questions.question_text: Kavya's uncle's daughter is her:
questions.explanation_correct: Kavya's uncle's daughter is her cousin. Your uncle's or aunt's children are your cousins.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Your uncle's daughter is not your sister, mother, or grandmother. She is your cousin. Cousins are the children of your uncles and aunts.

questions.question_text: How should we talk to our elders in the family?

options.text: We should not talk to them

questions.explanation_correct: We should talk to our elders with respect and love. Elders like parents and grandparents care for us, so we should be polite to them.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Being rude, shouting, or not talking to elders is wrong. We should always speak to our elders with respect and love because they care for us.

questions.question_text: Which family is bigger?
questions.explanation_correct: A family with 10 members is bigger than a family with 3 or 2 members. A family with many members is called a big or joint family.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A family with 3 or 2 members is smaller. A family with 10 members has more people and is therefore the bigger family.

questions.question_text: Riya's little brother fell down and is crying. What should Riya do?

options.text: Help him and tell her parents

questions.explanation_correct: Riya should help her brother and tell her parents. When a family member is hurt, we should help and get an adult to take care of them.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Laughing, walking away, or scolding a hurt child is unkind. Riya should help her brother up and tell her parents so they can check if he is okay.

questions.question_text: Arjun got new crayons. What should he do?
questions.explanation_correct: Arjun should share his crayons with his sister. Sharing with family members makes everyone happy and shows love.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Hiding, breaking, or throwing away crayons is not kind. Good family members share their things with each other.

questions.question_text: Your brother or sister is also called your:
questions.explanation_correct: Your brother or sister is also called your sibling. Siblings are children who have the same parents.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A brother or sister is not a parent, grandparent, or neighbour. They are called siblings. Siblings share the same parents.

questions.question_text: Tanvi lives with her mother, father, brother, grandmother, grandfather, uncle, aunt, and two cousins. How many people are in her family?
questions.explanation_correct: Count all the family members: Tanvi + mother + father + brother + grandmother + grandfather + uncle + aunt + 2 cousins = 10 people in total.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Let us count: Tanvi (1), mother (2), father (3), brother (4), grandmother (5), grandfather (6), uncle (7), aunt (8), cousin 1 (9), cousin 2 (10). There are 10 people in her family.

questions.question_text: Mother and father are our parents.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, our mother and father are our parents. They love us and take care of us.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Mother and father together are called parents. They are the ones who raise and care for us.

questions.question_text: A joint family has only two people.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. A joint family has many people like parents, children, grandparents, uncles, and aunts. It has more than two people.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A joint family does not have only two people. It has many family members like grandparents, parents, children, uncles, aunts, and cousins living together.

questions.question_text: Family members should help each other.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, family members should help each other. Helping and caring for each other makes a happy family.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. In a family, everyone should help each other. When we help each other, our family stays happy and strong.

questions.question_text: Grandparents are younger than parents.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. Grandparents are older than parents. They are the parents of our mother or father.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Grandparents are not younger than parents. Grandparents are older because they are the mother and father of our own parents.

questions.question_text: We should share our toys with our brothers and sisters.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, we should share our toys with our brothers and sisters. Sharing makes everyone happy and shows love.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Sharing with siblings is a good habit. It shows love and kindness, and playing together is more fun.

questions.question_text: Which of these shows that a family loves each other?

options.text: They eat together and help each other

questions.explanation_correct: Eating together and helping each other shows that a family loves each other. In happy families, members spend time together and help when needed.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Fighting, not talking, or living apart does not show love. Eating together and helping each other are signs of a loving family.

questions.question_text: Priya's father's mother tells her bedtime stories. Who is she?
questions.explanation_correct: Priya's father's mother is her grandmother, called Dadi in Hindi. Grandmothers often tell stories to their grandchildren.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Priya's father's mother is not Priya's mother, aunt, or sister. She is Priya's grandmother (Dadi).

questions.question_text: Rahul lives with only his mother and father. His grandparents live in a different city. What type of family does Rahul live in?
questions.explanation_correct: Rahul lives with only his mother and father, so it is a small family or nuclear family. Even though his grandparents live elsewhere, his home family is small.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rahul's family at home has only his parents, so it is a small or nuclear family. A joint family would have grandparents, uncles, and aunts all living in the same house.

questions.question_text: On Holi, what do families do?

options.text: Play with colours and eat special food together

questions.explanation_correct: On Holi, families play with colours and eat special food together. It is a festival of colours where everyone celebrates and has fun as a family.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Holi is a festival holiday, not a school day. Families do not stay in bed or do homework. They play with colours, eat sweets like gujiya, and celebrate together.

questions.question_text: Who helps you get ready for school in the morning?

options.text: Family members like mother or father

questions.explanation_correct: Family members like mother or father help you get ready for school. They wake you up, help you dress, and give you breakfast.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Shopkeepers, strangers, or nobody do not help us get ready for school. Our family members like parents help us get ready each morning.

questions.question_text: We should respect our elders in the family.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, we should respect our elders like parents and grandparents. They love us and take care of us, so we should be polite and respectful.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Elders like parents, grandparents, uncles, and aunts care for us. We should always treat them with respect and love.

questions.question_text: A family with mother, father, and two children is a joint family.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. A family with only parents and children is a small or nuclear family, not a joint family. A joint family has grandparents, uncles, and aunts too.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A family with only mother, father, and children is called a nuclear or small family. For it to be a joint family, grandparents, uncles, or aunts must also live together.

questions.question_text: How many parents do we have?
questions.explanation_correct: We have 2 parents: a mother and a father. Together they are called our parents.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not have 1, 3, or 4 parents. We have 2 parents: our mother and our father.

questions.question_text: Kabir's grandmother is not feeling well. Who should Kabir tell?

options.text: His parents so they can help

questions.explanation_correct: Kabir should tell his parents so they can help grandmother. When a family member is not well, we should quickly tell other family members or adults who can help.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Friends at school, the ice cream man, or nobody cannot help grandmother at home. Kabir should tell his parents right away so they can take care of grandmother.

questions.question_text: What is special about a joint family?
questions.explanation_correct: A joint family is special because many family members live together. Grandparents, parents, children, uncles, aunts, and cousins all share one home.
questions.explanation_incorrect: In a joint family, people do not live alone. There are many people, including children. A joint family is special because many family members live and share together.

questions.question_text: Your father's sister is your aunt.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, your father's sister is your aunt. In Hindi, she is called Bua.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Your father's sister is your aunt (Bua). She is one of your family members.

questions.question_text: What should you say when an elder gives you something?
questions.explanation_correct: We should say 'Thank you' when an elder gives us something. Saying thank you shows respect and good manners.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Saying nothing, demanding more, or being rude is not polite. We should always say 'Thank you' when someone gives us something.

questions.question_text: In Meera's family, there are 4 members: Meera, her mother, her father, and her brother. Who is the elder sibling if Meera is 6 years old and her brother is 4 years old?
questions.explanation_correct: Meera is the elder sibling because she is 6 years old and her brother is only 4 years old. The older child among siblings is the elder sibling.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Mother and father are parents, not siblings. Between Meera (6 years) and her brother (4 years), Meera is older, so she is the elder sibling.

questions.question_text: Families should celebrate festivals together.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, families should celebrate festivals together. Celebrating together brings happiness and makes the bond between family members stronger.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. When families celebrate festivals like Diwali, Holi, and Eid together, it makes everyone happy and brings the family closer.

questions.question_text: What do families often do at dinner time?
questions.explanation_correct: Families often sit together and eat food at dinner time. Eating together as a family is a happy time when everyone can talk and share about their day.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Running around, going to the market, or sleeping is not what families usually do at dinner time. Families sit together and eat their meal.

questions.question_text: All families are the same size.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. Families come in different sizes. Some are small with just parents and children, and some are big with many family members.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Not all families are the same size. Some families are small (nuclear families) and some are big (joint families). Each family is different.

questions.question_text: Dadi and Dada are Vikram's:
questions.explanation_correct: Dadi and Dada are Vikram's grandparents on his father's side. Dadi means grandmother and Dada means grandfather in Hindi.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dadi and Dada are not parents, friends, or teachers. They are Hindi words for grandmother and grandfather on the father's side of the family.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT a good way to behave in a family?

options.text: Helping your mother in the kitchen
Fighting with your brother every day

questions.explanation_correct: Fighting with your brother every day is NOT a good way to behave. Good family behaviour includes sharing, helping, and using polite words.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sharing food, helping mother, and saying please and thank you are all good behaviours. Fighting with your brother every day is the wrong behaviour in a family.

questions.question_text: Nani and Nana are grandparents on mother's side.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, Nani (grandmother) and Nana (grandfather) are your grandparents on your mother's side of the family.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. In Hindi, Nani means your mother's mother and Nana means your mother's father. They are your maternal grandparents.

questions.question_text: Isha wants to watch TV but her grandmother wants to watch the news. What should Isha do?

options.text: Let her grandmother watch first and wait for her turn

questions.explanation_correct: Isha should let her grandmother watch the news first and wait for her turn. Respecting elders and being patient is important in a family.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Shouting, snatching the remote, or breaking the TV are all very wrong things to do. Isha should respect her grandmother, let her watch first, and patiently wait for her own turn.
